Issues.Title: Potential bug in the routing example stackblitz program
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report ### Description The example presented in https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/router/stackblitz.html (live example) does not exhibit the behaviour claimed in the documentation at https://angular.io/guide/router#query-parameters-and-fragments. Namely, this: > Now, you can click on the Admin button, which takes you to the Login page with the provided queryParamMap and fragment. After you click the login button, notice that you have been redirected to the Admin Dashboard page with the query parameters and fragment still intact in the address bar. The query parameter and the fragment both get lost when you are forwarded to the "admin" page by the login button. You can see that the "Admin" page displays `Null` both for `Session ID` and for `Token`, as they are also absent in the address bar. The cause seems to be the `navigateByUrl()` call in `auth/login/login.component.ts` at line 40. This is what the official doc says for this function referring to its `extras` parameter: > NavigationExtras | An object containing properties that modify the navigation strategy. The function ignores any properties in the¬†NavigationExtras¬†that would change the provided URL. So if you replace line 40 ``` this.router.navigateByUrl(redirect, navigationExtras); ``` with ``` this.router.navigate([this.authService.redirectUrl], navigationExtras); ``` the app behaviour is then consistent with the expected description in the angular write-up. While `navigate()` is normally doing a relative navigation, in the absence of a "start" (`relativeTo`) position it will do the absolute navigation, but without the adverse effect of `navigateByUrl()`. Maybe not the most optimal solution though But notice that if this solution is adopted, the `UrlTree` `redirect` variable is then not necessary Also the Angular Doc write‚Äìup has to be updated as well to whatever solution is adopted ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction ### What's the affected URL?** https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/router/stackblitz.html and the documentation at https://angular.io/guide/router#query-parameters-and-fragments ### Reproduction Steps** Navigate to https://angular.io/generated/live-examples/router/stackblitz.html, then to `Admin` tab and click the `Login` button. You will see both `Session ID` and `Token` being `None` ### Expected vs Actual Behavior** `Session ID` should be `123456789`, and `Token` should be `anchor`, and not `None` Otherwise how are they persistent? ## üì∑Screenshot ## üî• Exception or Error
## üåç Your Environment ### Browser info ### Anything else relevant?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Potential bug in the routing example stackblitz program" (#34917)

## What is the current behavior?
At the end of the second code example under "**Configuring serve for ES5**", Markdown correctly formats `<app-name>:build:es5` as `<app-name>:build:es5`, but the rendered code sample online at angular.io doesn't show `<app-name>` at all, so it ends up being `"browserTarget": ":build:es5"`, which makes the note below the code sample confusing as it says to replace `<app-name>`, which doesn't exist.

Code example is rendered correctly to match the hint underneath. I don't know if there's a way to render "less than" and "greater than" symbols correctly online, so I used all caps with an underscore delimiter.

Issues.Title: refactor(language-service): Consistent naming between ts and ng LanguageService
Issues.Body:
This commit makes the Angular Language Service interface a strict subset
of TypeScript Language Service by renaming all methods to be
consistent with TypeScript's.

| Old Name | New Name |
| --- | --- |
| `getDiagnostics` | `getSemanticDiagnostics` |
| `getCompletionsAt` | `getCompletionsAtPosition` |
| `getDefinitionAt` | `getDefinitionAndBoundSpan` |
| `getHoverAt` | `getQuickInfoAtPosition` |


The custom Angular `LanguageService` interface was needed before the
inception of TypeScript tsserver plugin, but is now obsolete since
Angular LS is a proper tsserver plugin.

This allows us to easily adapt to upstream TS changes in the future, and
also allows us to reuse all data types defined in TypeScript.

Issues.Title: build: vendor yarn using the .yarnrc yarn-path value
Issues.Body:
Rather than enforcing yarn versioning using `package.json`'s
engines value.  We can utilize yarn's `yarn-path` value to
ensure that the version of yarn used at execution time is
consistent for everyone who uses our repo.  This is the first
step in this wider vendoring process.  We will use this same
vendoring mechanism for CI after https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/pull/1569 lands
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: vendor yarn using the .yarnrc yarn-path value" (#34902)

Issues.Title: fix(common): remove extra & in http params
Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [ ] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

<!-- Please check the one that applies to this PR using "x". -->

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?

HTTP params like
```typescript
{a: '', b: [], c: '3'}
```
result in a request with `a=&&c=3` (note the extra `&` introduced by `b` and its empty array)

Issue Number: couldn't find one

## What is the new behavior?

There are two ways to fix this:
- be coherent and generate `a=&b=&c=3`. This would be the best but it is a breaking change as ome people may rely on the current behavior of not having the array parameter sent if it is empty.
- be compatible and just remove the extra & in the URL `a=&c=3`

After discussing with @petebacondarwin we went for the simple and compatible fix.

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No, although some developers may have some unit tests that need to be fixed if they are checking the generated requests of their services.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(common): remove extra & in http params" (#34896)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): switch ngcc over to use the `TraitCompiler`
Issues.Body:
fix(ngcc): do not attempt compilation when analysis fails

In #34288, ngtsc was refactored to separate the result of the analysis
and resolve phase for more granular incremental rebuilds. In this model,
any errors in one phase transition the trait into an error state, which
prevents it from being ran through subsequent phases. The ngcc compiler
on the other hand did not adopt this strict error model, which would
cause incomplete metadata‚Äîdue to errors in earlier phases‚Äîto be offered
for compilation that could result in a hard crash.

This commit updates ngcc to take advantage of ngtsc's `TraitCompiler`,
that internally manages all Ivy classes that are part of the
compilation. This effectively replaces ngcc's own `AnalyzedFile` and
`AnalyzedClass` types, together with all of the logic to drive the
`DecoratorHandler`s. All of this is now handled in the `TraitCompiler`,
benefiting from its explicit state transitions of `Trait`s so that the
ngcc crash is a thing of the past.

Fixes #34500
Resolves FW-1788

Issues.Body:

### Command (mark with an `x`)

- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update

### Is this a regression?

Maybe. In the previous version, I did not had the problem. Actually, I used npm audit fix because of the security issue in tree-kill. So I went from 8.3.21 to 8.3.23.


### Description

Following my npm audit fix, I cannot run ionic serve anymore. I have this issue :
` ERROR in ./node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/src/angular-cli-files/models/jit-polyfills.js
[ng] Module not found: Error: Can't resolve 'core-js/proposals/reflect-metadata' in 'project\node_modules\@angular-devkit\build-angular\src\angular-cli-files\models'`



## üåç Your Environment
I'm using Angular with Ionic 5.4.9, npm 6.1.10 and node 12.14.0.

Issues.Title: Correctly prints the size of the chunk during the build statistic print
Issues.Body:
This commits allows the cli to correctly print the sum of the sizes of the assets of a given chunk instead of the size of the first emitted asset

Attached:
-Before.PNG: What was happening before the fix in my local environment
-After.PNG: What's happening after the fix, notice that now the size of the "main-client" is the actual sum of the sizes of main-client.js and initial.css
-[webpack.config.js](https://pastebin.com/MreT3kuc): As requested, my current webpack configuration. This problem happens when i'm using the [MiniCssExtractPlugin ](https://github.com/webpack-contrib/mini-css-extract-plugin)to extract my initial.css together with the main client

After.PNG
![After](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12494403/72915189-32573a00-3d40-11ea-97d7-9bcfd149b48f.PNG)

Issues.Title: [lint] TSLint 6.0 support
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request

### Command (mark with an `x`)
- [x] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [x] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

TSLint released a v6.0 version (marked as deprecated, and containing a few breaking changes).
The `ng lint` command only accepts a version up to v5.x so trying to bumpt TSLint results in `[error] Error: TSLint must be version 5.5 or higher.` (as mentioned in this TSLint issue https://github.com/palantir/tslint/issues/4910)

I already fixed this in #16058 but this was merged in v9, and not v8. It might be enough though.

### Describe the solution you'd like

I think that it would be nice to:
- [ ] allow users to upgrade to TSLint v6 and be able to use it, which implies fixing the check (done in v9 but not in v8, is it important?).
- [ ] change the version used in the schematics for `ng new`
- [ ] change the deault configuration in the schematics as well, as v6.0 includes a few breaking changes in `tslint:recommended` that we extend (see https://github.com/palantir/tslint/pull/4871/files and https://github.com/palantir/tslint/pull/4312/files)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[lint] TSLint 6.0 support" (#16733)

Issues.Title: rc.8 to rc.9|rc.10 regression : stuck in "Generating ES5 bundles for differential loading..." if sourceMap is on
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes with sourceMap: true or sourceMap: { "scripts": true, "styles": true, "vendor": true } works with "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.900.0-rc.8", "@angular/cli": "9.0.0-rc.8", and even with "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.900.0-rc.8", "@angular/cli": "9.0.0-rc.10", but fails with "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.900.0-rc.9", "@angular/cli": "9.0.0-rc.9", or "@angular-devkit/build-angular": "0.900.0-rc.10", "@angular/cli": "9.0.0-rc.10", ### Description Building a project with sourceMap:true using @angular-devkit/build-angular rc.9 or rc.10 results in build stuck (from few seconds when working to > 20 min and counting - did not have patience to wait for an eventual end or crash) in "Generating ES5 bundles for differential loading..." phase Building the same project with @angular-devkit/build-angular rc.8 works well (30 seconds) Setting sourceMap: false solves the problem with rc.9 or rc.10 project dependencies : ```json "dependencies": { "@angular/animations": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/common": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/compiler": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/core": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/forms": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/localize": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/platform-browser": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/platform-browser-dynamic": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/platform-server": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/pwa": "0.900.0-rc.9", "@angular/router": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@angular/service-worker": "9.0.0-rc.9", "@fortawesome/fontawesome-pro": "^5.12.0", "@ng-bootstrap/ng-bootstrap": "^5.2.0", "@nguniversal/express-engine": "^9.0.0-next.14", "@sentry/browser": "^5.11.1", "@sentry/node": "^5.11.1", "autotrack": "^2.4.1", "bootstrap": "^4.4.1", "compression": "^1.7.4", "connect-timeout": "^1.9.0", "cookie-parser": "^1.4.4", "express": "^4.17.1", "flag-icon-css": "^3.4.5", "lodash-es": "^4.17.15", "memory-cache": "^0.2.0", "ng-cli-pug-loader": "^0.2.2", "ng2-pdf-viewer": "^6.0.2", "rxjs": "~6.5.4", "tslib": "^1.10.0", "typeface-lato": "^0.0.75", "typeface-oswald": "^1.1.3", "typeface-roboto": "^0.0.75", "typeface-ubuntu": "^0.0.65", "zone.js": "~0.10.2" }, ``` build portion of angular.json ```json { "fileReplacements": [ { "replace": "src/environments/environment.ts", "with": "src/environments/environment.staging.ts" } ], "optimization": true, "outputHashing": "all", "outputPath": "dist/browser", "sourceMap": true, "extractCss": true, "namedChunks": false, "aot": true, "extractLicenses": true, "vendorChunk": false, "buildOptimizer": true, "budgets": [ { "type": "initial", "maximumWarning": "2mb", "maximumError": "5mb" } ], "baseHref": "/", "localize": ["fr", "en", "de", "es"] }, ``` tsconfig.json ```json { "compileOnSave": false, "compilerOptions": { "baseUrl": "./", "outDir": fullTemplateTypeCheck to false with no difference. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction I have not been able to setup a minimal reproduction, and the project is internal. Issues.Title: not able to use ngx-contextmenu for angular 9
Issues.Body:
I was using ngx-contextmenu library with angular 8  and it was working fine.
i have upgraded my version of angular from angular 8 to angular 9. Now, ngx-contextmenu is not working.

It throws the following error:
ERROR in ./node_modules/ngx-contextmenu/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/ngx-contextmenu.js 454:16-24
"export 'Renderer' was not found in '@angular/core'
ERROR in ./node_modules/ngx-contextmenu/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/ngx-contextmenu.js 476:304-312
"export 'Renderer' was not found in '@angular/core'
ERROR in ./node_modules/ngx-contextmenu/__ivy_ngcc__/fesm5/ngx-contextmenu.js 511:26-34
"export 'Renderer' was not found in '@angular/core'
    
    ERROR in node_modules/ngx-contextmenu/lib/contextMenuContent.component.d.ts:3:56 - error TS2724: Module '"../../@angular/core/core"' has no exported member 'Renderer'. Did you mean 'Renderer2'?
    
    3 import { AfterViewInit, ChangeDetectorRef, ElementRef, Renderer } from '@angular/core';
                                                             ~~~~~~~~
    
      node_modules/@angular/core/core.d.ts:5680:31
        5680 export declare abstract class Renderer2 {
                                           ~~~~~~~~~
        'Renderer2' is declared here.
    
When upgraded from angular 8 to angular 9  (for Renderer): this was update for Renderer that happened
**Renderer to Renderer2 migration.
  As of Angular 9, the Renderer class is no longer available.
  Renderer2 should be used instead.
  Read more about this here: https://v9.angular.io/guide/migration-renderer
  Migration completed. successfull**

Is ngx-contextmenu library not supported in angular 9?
https://www.npmjs.com/package/ngx-contextmenu

Is there any other alternate library that we can use for contextmenu in angular9

Issues.Title: Inconsistent use of exported bundles for an ES5 build vs an ES2015 build with differential loading
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? unsure ### Description The angular build features differential loading (awesome!), i.e. the build optionally generates two copies of the app, one for es2015 and one for es5. The es5 code however seems to be the es2015 version of the full application build transpiled to es5. I think that this is incorrect, the build should pick up the dedicated es5 exports from libraries it uses. In its current form it assumes that the es5 exports of all libraries are transpiled versions of their es2015 exports. This is not necessarily true. A library could decide to use hand-optimized version for es5 and es2015. If I configure the Angular application build to use es5 as a target, then the build process would use the es5 exports of the libraries. The Angular package format documentation clearly documents different es5 and es2015 entry points into libraries. I would expect them to be used consistently. ## üåç Your Environment

Issues.Title: RC8 Breaks Hybrid App in IE11 Because of Upgrade to core-js 3.6.0 in @angular-devkit/build-angular
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [x] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 9.0.0-RC7 ### Description We are having an issue in IE11 where the download of the vendor.js and main.js files during a `ng build` or `ng serve` never completes. It shows a pending forever in the network tab and we theorize that this is because it is getting some kind of parsing error. We first tracked it down to the @angular-dev-kit/build-angular and then to this commit (https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/commit/6ffa74acead4798a42f82b4a3001fec26625d738) which upgraded core-js 3.3.6 to 3.6.0 to the build-angular dependencies. Any build after this one (https://github.com/angular/angular-devkit-build-angular-builds/commit/cbd21fa9307631006689f42f2afeb986f5c4f5be) fails to load in IE11 with either a never ending spinner or a long running script error. No other errors ever present themselves in the console. For any build after the one listed above, if you go into the `node_modules/@angular-devkit/build-angular/node_modules` and delete the `core-js` folder, then node will revert to the project `core-js` folder (we can verify it works at 3.1.4, 3.3.6, and 3.5.0) and everything works just fine. We have tested this with the most recent commits/builds and this is still an issue with 3.6.4 of core-js. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction This is super hard to reproduce because we are running an AngularJS and Angular hybrid app with over half a million lines of code. We are not sure what in our build process is causing the issue but it is for sure being caused by the upgrade to version 3.6.x of `core-js`. We are very happy to do any kind of screen share or provide more information if that is required. We are attempting to make a project that makes this reproducable ## üî• Exception or Error The only error is sometimes it errors with "...not responding due to a long running script" ## üåç Your Environment

Node: 12.13.0
OS: darwin x64

Issues.Title: Regression problem in tsconfig.json outDir that cause VSCode showing errors in all import from libs pointed with paths under /dist/...
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [x] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 8.3.23 ### Description The root tsconfig.json used in the new v9.0.0-rc* template point `"outDir": "./dist"` That caused annoying problem in VSCode when you rebuild libs referred by `"paths"` all the code `imports {...} from lib` is marked as Errors by TS because they are build under `/dist/...` ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Run those commands: ``` npx @angular/cli@next new --createApplication=false my-workspace cd my-workspace npm run ng -- generate library my-lib npm run ng -- generate application my-app ``` The above commands are needed to setup the workspace for the repro with an application and a library pointed in the tsconfig.json ```"paths": { "my-lib": ["dist/my-lib"] }``` then add this line to app.module.ts to use the library inside the application: ``` // app.module.ts import { MyLibModule } from 'my-lib'; ``` and then run the compilation of the my-lib project in watch mode: ``` npm run ng -- build project=my-lib --watch ``` You will see in VSCode that all imports pointing to the my-lib will be signal as TS Errors 2307 ## üî• Exception or Error 

Can't find module 'my-lib' ts(2307)
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 9.0.0-rc.9
Node: 12.14.1
OS: darwin x64

... animations, cli, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms

    component: BaseComponent,

        loadChildren: () => import('../app/views/pages/dashboard/dashboard.module').then(m => m.DashboardModule)

      },
      {

        component: ErrorPageComponent,
        data: {
          type: 'error-v6',
          code: 403,
          title: '403... Access forbidden',
          desc: "Looks like you don't have permission to access for requested page.
 Please, contact administrator"

      { path: '**', redirectTo: 'dashboard', pathMatch: 'full' }
    ]
  },

  { path: '**', redirectTo: 'error/403', pathMatch: 'full' }
];

@NgModule({
  imports: [RouterModule.forRoot(routes)],
  exports: [RouterModule]
})
export class AppRoutingModule {}

Issues.Title: build: fix sass async worker patch causing successful builds to fail
Issues.Body:
The sass async worker patch seems to cause successful builds to fail.
This is because the `@bazel/worker` package expects the Promise to
resolve with a boolean (`true` = good, `false` failing build).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix sass async worker patch causing successful builds to fail" (#18260)

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(popover-edit): Call markForCheck against row hover content" (#18258)

Issues.Title: feat(material-experimental/chip): Add focus indicators
Issues.Body:
- Added three different kinds of focus indicators to MDC chip:
  - Added a focus indicator for when the chip itself is focusable.
  - Added a focus indicator for when the text inside the chip is focusable.
  - Added a focus indicator for when the "Remove" icon inside the chip is focusable.
- In order to add a focus indicator for the chip itself, the chip is no longer the `RippleTarget`. Now, there is a dedicated ripple target element within the chip.
- Added UT coverage.

Note: I'm not sure why it shows up with 5 commits... I can fix it if reviewers would like but I'm not sure it's actually a problem.

Issues.Title: mat-datepicker select "in" and "out" type for two-way binding (e.g. ISO date string)
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description

Please provide a way to deal with ISO date strings in two-way binding (e.g. `ngModel`).

Probably it does not end with the ISO date string as a possible type. Let's say another example is to use `google.protobuf.Timestamp` from protobuf as input and output for the model.

It might be that I'm repeating another issue here, however I did not succeed finding one.

#### Use Case

I want to pass string as input for datepicker and receive string as output. That's normally a quite expected behavior from a form input and it is definitely not in place; a `Moment` instance is replacing my input, although it was of type `string` (I use moment date adapter)

Currently I need to perform ugly patching like `(ngModelChange)="contact.birthDate = $event.toISOString()"`

```html
<mat-form-field>
    <mat-label>{{ 'entity:ContactPerson/property:birthDate/name' | translate }}</mat-label>
    <input matInput [matDatepicker]="picker" #birthDateModel="ngModel" [(ngModel)]="contact.birthDate" name="contact.birthDate" (ngModelChange)="contact.birthDate = $event.toISOString()">
    <mat-datepicker-toggle matSuffix [for]="picker"></mat-datepicker-toggle>
    <mat-datepicker #picker></mat-datepicker>
  </mat-form-field>
```

[Another example on SO](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55657747/how-to-two-way-bind-angular-material-datepicker-to-a-string-property)

If there is another cleaner way to achieve the string in -> string out (or any custom type) behavior, please guide me.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "mat-datepicker select "in" and "out" type for two-way binding (e.g. ISO date string)" (#18253)

Issues.Title: Entry point configuration check should run against release package
Issues.Body:
The entry-point configuration CI check should run against the release package, and not run simply against the `config.bzl` file. The reason for this is that we don't need to generate manifests and pass data through `.bzl` files to the JS script. 

Also configuring does not always mean that the entry point is actually released. We could incorporate this into the release validation scripts that already run on CI anyway.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Entry point configuration check should run against release package" (#18250)

Issues.Title: build: fix local browser testing target for macOS and linux
Issues.Body:
Fixes the local browser testing target for macOS and Linux. The target is still somewhat broken on Windows due to a Bazel change in behavior: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/10621.

There is a valid workaround for windows though, so it's should be good to move forward with this. It's still the recommended approach by `rules_nodejs` that web test target's can be run with `bazel run`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "build: fix local browser testing target for macOS and linux" (#18237)

Issues.Title: [mat-chip-list] Change event doesn't provide reliable results and breaks when multiple property is changed
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

StackBlitz to reproduce issue(s): https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-14snje

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click "One Fish"
2. Change event says that "One Fish" is the only selected chip even though 2 other tags are also selected
3. Click "toggle multiple" to disable multiple selection
4. Click "Two Fish"
5. "One Fish" and "Two fish" are shown to be selected, but the change event says only "One Fish" is selected
6. Click "One Fish"
7. Now the change event says that only "Two Fish" is selected
8. Remove HTML attribute "multiple" from mat-chip-list in code and restart app
9. Click "One Fish"
10. Only "One Fish" is selected
11. Click "toggle multiple" to enable multiple selection
12. Click "Two Fish"
13. Both "One Fish" and "Two Fish" are shown to be selected, but the change event says that only "Two Fish" is selected
 
#### Expected Behavior

The change event triggered by mat-chip-list should always match the chips that are visually marked as selected.
When the multiple property is changed to false, only the first selected chip should remain selected.

#### Actual Behavior

1. The list doesn't include pre-selected chips in the first change event (i.e. chips that are selected at their creation time)
2. If multiple is initially false and then later changed to true, the change-event values array never contains more than 1 value even though multiple tags can be visually marked as being selected

#### Environment

- Angular: 8.2.14
- CDK/Material: 8.2.3
- Browser(s): Chrome
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): Windows
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[mat-chip-list] Change event doesn't provide reliable results and breaks when multiple property is changed" (#18245)

Issues.Title: [cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport][mat-table] - sticky headers is not working properly when combining mat-table with cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Use StackBlitz to reproduce your issue: https://stackblitz.com/fork/components-issue
https://stackblitz.com/edit/virtual-scroll-table-sticky-headers

Steps to reproduce:
1. wrap mat-table within a cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport element
2. add sticky: true property to *matHeaderRowDef directive as stated in documentation
3. observe sticky header slide down the viewport after about 10 rows. 
 
#### Expected Behavior
Expect when adding the sticky:true; property to mat-table *matHeaderRowDef directive wrapped within a cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport that the headers remain positioned at the top of the viewport.

#### Actual Behavior
As you scroll the cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport slides the entire mat-table instead of just the row contents wrapped in the tbody element.

#### Environment

- Angular: >= 7
- CDK/Material: >= 7
- Browser(s): chrome, firefox, opera, safari
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): all
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport][mat-table] - sticky headers is not working properly when combining mat-table with cdk-virtual-scroll-viewport" (#18240)

Issues.Title: @angular/google-maps | Issue Setting a Custom Marker Icon
Issues.Body:
#### Bug, feature request, or proposal: Setting a custom icon seems to trigger an infinite loop.
{{ currentlySelectedTruckTask?.customerFirstName }}
map.component.ts ... getMarkerOptions(item: T): google.maps.MarkerOptions { return { icon: '/assets/map-icons/emergency-icon.png', draggable: false }; } #### What is the expected behavior? Have getMarkerOptions only called once per map-marker. #### What is the current behavior? Code gets called recursively, as if responding to change detection, until it overflows. It seems to work fine with static MarkerOptions. #### Which versions of Angular, Material, OS, TypeScript, browsers are affected? "@angular/core": "~8.2.14", "@angular/google-maps": "^9.0.0-rc.0", #### Is there anything else we should know? I do not believe so.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "@angular/google-maps | Issue Setting a Custom Marker Icon" (#18233)

Issues.Title: multi vs multiple
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

Today I came across this minor not consistency. I was working with a mat-accordion and a mat-toggle-button-group. In both components I used the multi(mat-accordion) and the multiple (mat-toggle-button-group) attribute, which are on a perspective doing the same and I was just wondering why they are not named the same. Bit of picky here, but it might improve the workflow.
https://material.angular.io/components/expansion/api
https://material.angular.io/components/button-toggle/api
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "multi vs multiple" (#18234)
